definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: Liberal pundits foam at the mouth.
sentences.chinese: 自由黨專家氣得口吐白沫。

sentences.english: After sitting down, he is abrupt buccal foam dies.
sentences.chinese: 坐下後，他突然口吐白沫死亡。

sentences.english: The sick dog foamed at the mouth.
The dying animal was found foaming at the mouth.
sentences.chinese: 那隻將死的動物被發現口吐白沫。

sentences.english: He suddenly staggered and foamed a little at the mouth, and fell.
sentences.chinese: 突然間，它蹣跚起來，口吐一些白沫就倒了下去。

sentences.english: Putting a chopstick in a glass before pouring in beer can prevent foam.
sentences.chinese: 倒啤酒時，杯子裏放一根筷子就不會起白沫了。

sentences.english: The rabid dog foamed at the mouth.
sentences.chinese: 那隻狗染上狂犬病，口吐白沫。

sentences.english: Animals with rabies often froth at the mouth.
sentences.chinese: 患狂犬病的動物經常口吐白沫。

sentences.english: The sick animal was frothing at the mouth.
sentences.chinese: 那隻患病的動物在口吐白沫。

sentences.english: The foam in Ron's mouth in one scene is made of egg white.
sentences.chinese: 羅恩在影片中嘴角的白沫其實是用蛋白做出來的。

sentences.english: Frothing from mouth, jaw chomping, muscle tremors and eyelids snapping.
sentences.chinese: 口吐白沫，牙關緊閉，肌肉震顫，眼瞼外露。

sentences.english: He looked like a madman, foaming at the mouth.
sentences.chinese: 他口吐白沫，看上去像個瘋子。

sentences.english: When people die in hot weather, they usually foam at the mouth just as he did.
sentences.chinese: 大凡人死在熱天，就會冒出這種白沫來，我見過。

sentences.english: Warrior wolf spat out white foams and died.
sentences.chinese: 吞下石羊的武大狼口吐白沫，死了。

sentences.english: We just saw the foaming white wake of the liner.
sentences.chinese: w我們只看到班輪駛過留下的白沫翻騰的航跡。

sentences.english: When the ship sailed, the foaming white wake of the liner was left.
sentences.chinese: 輪船駛過，留下了白沫翻騰的航跡。

definition: wisps of blood/visible veins/(of eyes) bloodshot
to let drip/to trickle down/to shed (tears)
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to turn over/to surge/to churn/to rummage/raging (torrent)
